titleproper.value:
Guide to the Stella Snead Photograph Collection 
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1972-89, undated</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 185</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Andrea Walton

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2017-04-14T09:25-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Stella Snead was a British Surrealist painter and collage artist; later becoming a photographer noted for books on India. She documented the streets and neighborhoods of New York City where she lived for many years. The collection spans the period from 1972-89 and consists of 133 gelatin silver photographs divided into four areas of interest: Architectural Elements (66); Brooklyn Bridge (8); Central Park (10); Lincoln Center Towers Construction (48); Street Scenes (1).

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. See guidelines in Print Room for details.
This collection should be cited as: The Stella Snead Photograph Collection 1972-1989, PR 185, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Street Scenes contains one image of 57th street on a rainy day.

subject.value: Architecture -- New York (State) -- New York -- Details -- Photographs.
Decoration and ornament, Architectural -- New York (State) -- New York -- Photographs.
